document.heading: Consecutive Term Limitation Amendment Act of 2001

history.narrative: Law 14-26, the “Consecutive Term Limitation Amendment Act of 2001,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-25, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 1, 2001, and June 5, 2001, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on June 22, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 14-79 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-26 became effective on October 2, 2001.
